info.description:
This API serves the BHLnames app. It locates relevant sections in the Biodiversity Heritage Library that correspond provided names, references or pages.

Code repository: https://github.com/gnames/bhlnames.

Access the API on the production server: https://bhlnames.globalnames.org/api/v1.
info.title: BHLnames API

get.description: Gives information where to find docs.

get.summary: Get nomenclatural event data by external ID from a data source.

200.description: Matched references for the provided external ID

get.summary: Get metadata and taxonomic statistics of a BHL item.

post.description: Finds BHL references for a name, does not include references of synonyms.
post.summary: Finds BHL references for a name, taxon, or nomenclatural event

200.description: Matched references for the provided name

get.description: Finds BHL references for a name, does not include references of synonyms. There is an option to find references for the nomenclatural event of a name.
get.summary: Finds BHL references for a name, taxon, or nomenclatural event

parameters.description: Reference data used to filter results.
parameters.name: reference

parameters.description: If true, tries to find nomenclatural event reference.
parameters.name: nomen_event

200.description: Matched references for the provided name

get.description: Checks if the API is online and returns a simple response if it is.
get.summary: Check if API service is online

get.description: Retrieves the BHL reference metadata by pageID.
get.summary: Get BHL reference metadata by pageID

200.description: Successful response with data about the reference

get.summary: Get BHL items where a given higher taxon is prevalent.

200.description: BHL items with metadata and statistics

get.description: Retrieves the current version of the BHLnames application.

bhl.Item.description: Item represents a BHL item, usually a journal volume of a journal or a book. It includes metadata about the item and statistics about the taxonomic groups mentioned in the item.

KingdomBacteriaNum.description: BacteriaNum is the number of names that belong to the Bacteria kingdom.

doiTitle.description: TitleDOI provides DOI for the title.

itemId.description: ItemID is the BHL database ID for the Item.

kingdomAnimaliaNum.description: AnimaliaNum is the number of names that belong to the Animalia kingdom.

kingdomFungiNum.description: FungiNum is the number of names that belong to the Fungi kingdom.

kingdomPlantaeNum.description: PlantaeNum is the number of names that belong to the Plantae kingdom.

mainClass.description: MainClass is the most prevalent class in the Item.

mainClassPercent.description:
MainClassPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent class.

mainFamily.description: MainFamily is the most prevalent family in the Item.

mainFamilyPercent.description:
MainFamilyPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent family.

mainGenus.description: MainGenus is the most prevalent genus in the Item.

mainGenusPercent.description:
MainGenusPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent genus.

mainKingdom.description: MainKingdom is the most prevalent kingdom in the Item.

mainKingdomPercent.description:
MainKingdomPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent kingdom.

mainOrder.description: MainOrder is the most prevalent order in the Item.

mainOrderPercent.description:
MainOrderPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent order.

mainPhylum.description: MainPhylum is the most prevalent phylum in the Item.

mainPhylumPercent.description:
MainPhylumPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent phylum.

mainTaxon.description:
MainTaxon provides a clade that contains a majority of scientific names
mentioned in the Item.

mainTaxonPercent.description:
MainTaxonPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the main taxon.

mainTaxonRank.description: MainTaxonRank is the rank of the main taxon.

titleId.description: TitleID is the BHL database ID for the Title (book or journal).

titleName.description: TitleName is the name of a title (a book or a journal).
titleName.example: Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History

titleYearEnd.description: TitleYearEnd is the year when the journal ceased publication.

titleYearStart.description:
TitleYearStart is the year the when book is published, or
a journal started publication.

uniqNamesNum.description: UniqNamesNum is the number of unique names in the Item.

volume.description: Volume is the information about a volume in a journal.

yearEnd.description: YearEnd is the year when the Item ceased publication.

yearStart.description: YearStart is the year when the Item began publication.

bhl.ItemStats.description: ItemStats provides insights about a Reference's Item. This data can be used to infer the prevalent taxonomic groups within the Item.

KingdomBacteriaNum.description: BacteriaNum is the number of names that belong to the Bacteria kingdom.

kingdomAnimaliaNum.description: AnimaliaNum is the number of names that belong to the Animalia kingdom.

kingdomFungiNum.description: FungiNum is the number of names that belong to the Fungi kingdom.

kingdomPlantaeNum.description: PlantaeNum is the number of names that belong to the Plantae kingdom.

mainClass.description: MainClass is the most prevalent class in the Item.

mainClassPercent.description:
MainClassPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent class.

mainFamily.description: MainFamily is the most prevalent family in the Item.

mainFamilyPercent.description:
MainFamilyPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent family.

mainGenus.description: MainGenus is the most prevalent genus in the Item.

mainGenusPercent.description:
MainGenusPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent genus.

mainKingdom.description: MainKingdom is the most prevalent kingdom in the Item.

mainKingdomPercent.description:
MainKingdomPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent kingdom.

mainOrder.description: MainOrder is the most prevalent order in the Item.

mainOrderPercent.description:
MainOrderPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent order.

mainPhylum.description: MainPhylum is the most prevalent phylum in the Item.

mainPhylumPercent.description:
MainPhylumPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the most prevalent phylum.

mainTaxon.description:
MainTaxon provides a clade that contains a majority of scientific names
mentioned in the Item.

mainTaxonPercent.description:
MainTaxonPercent indicates the percentage of names that belong
to the main taxon.

mainTaxonRank.description: MainTaxonRank is the rank of the main taxon.

uniqNamesNum.description: UniqNamesNum is the number of unique names in the Item.

bhl.Meta.description: Meta provides metadata for the results of a name-string search.

canonical.description: Canonical is a full canonical form of the input name-string.

currentCanonical.description:
CurrentCanonical is a full canonical form of a currently accepted
name for the taxon of the input name-string.

imagesURL.description: ImagesURL provides URL that contains images of the taxon.

input.description: Input of a name and/or reference

inputReferenceFrom.description:
InputReferenceFrom indicates that input references were taked from
a data source.

nomenEventFromCache.description:
NomenEventFromCache indicates that nomenclatural event was taken from
a pre-cached data.

synonyms.description: Synonyms is a list of synonyms for the name-string.

totalRefsNum.description: ReferenceNumber is the number of references found for the name-string.

bhl.NameData.description: NameData contains details about a scientific name in the BHL reference.

annotNomen.description: AnnotNomen is a nomenclatural annotation located near the matchted name.

editDistance.description:
EditDistance is the number of differences (edit events)
between Name and MatchName according to Levenshtein algorithm.

matchName.description: MatchedName is a scientific name match from the reference's text.

name.description: Name is a scientific name from the query.

bhl.Part.description: Part represents a distinct entity, usually a scientific paper,

doi.description: DOI provides DOI for a part (usually a paper/publication).

id.description: ID is the BHL database ID for the Part (usually a scientific paper).

name.example: On a remarkable bacterium (Streptococcus) from wheat-ensilage

pages.description: Pages are the start and end pages of a publication.

year.description: Year is the year of publication for a part.

bhl.Reference.description: Reference represents a BHL reference that matched the query. This could be a book, a journal, or a scientific paper.

doiTitle.description: TitleDOI provides DOI for a book or journal

itemId.description: ItemID is the BHL database ID for Item (usually a volume).

itemStats.description:
ItemStats provides insights about the Reference Item.
From this data it is possible to infer what kind of
taxonomic groups are prevalent in the text.

itemYearEnd.description: ItemYearEnd is the year when an Item ceased publication.

itemYearStart.description:
ItemYearStart is the year when an Item began publication (most
items will have only ItemYearStart).

pageId.description:
PageID is the BHL database ID for the page where the name was found.
It is provided by BHL.

pageNum.description: PageNum is the page number provided by the hard copy of the publication.

part.description:
Part corresponds to a scientific paper, or other
distinct entity in an Item.

titleId.description: TitleID is the BHL database ID for the Title (book or journal).

titleName.description: TitleName is the name of a title (a book or a journal).
titleName.example: Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History

titleYearEnd.description: TitleYearEnd is the year when the journal ceased publication.

titleYearStart.description:
TitleYearStart is the year the when book is published,
or when the journal was first published.

url.description: URL is the URL of the reference in BHL.

volume.description: Volume is the information about a volume in a journal.

yearAggr.description:
YearAggr is the most precise year information available for the
reference. This could be from the reference year (part),
the year of a Volume (item), or from the title (usually a book
or journal).

yearType.description: YearType indicates the source of the YearAggr value.

bhl.ReferenceName.description: ReferenceName represents a BHL entity that includes a matched scientific name and the reference where this name was discovered.

name.description:
NameData contains detailed information about the scientific name found
in the BHL reference.

refMatchQuality.description:
RefMatchQuality provides a number between 0 and 5 to indicate if
the reference is a good match for the input.
1 - nothing is found
2 - 15% (Odds > 0.01)
3 - 50% (Odds > 0.1)
4 - 80% (Odds > 1)
5 - 98% (Odds > 10)

reference.description: Reference is the BHL reference where the name was detected.

score.description:
Score is the overall score of the match between the reference and
a name-string or a reference-string.

bhl.RefsByName.description: RefsByName provides references to BHL Items, Parts and Pages where a name-string, taxon or a putative nomenclatural event were found.

meta.description: Meta provides metadata for the results of a name-string search.

references.description:
References is a list of references to BHL Items, Parts and Pages
where a name-string was found.

bhl.Score.description: Score provides a qualitative estimation of a match quality to a name-string, a nomen, or a reference-string.

annot.description:
Annot is a score important for nomenclatural events and provides match
for nomenclatural annotations.

labels.description: Labels provide types for each match

odds.description: Odds is total Naive Bayes odds for the score.

oddsDetail.description: OddsDetail provides details of the odds calculation.

pages.description:
RefPages is a score derived from matching pages in a reference
and a page from BHL.

title.description: RefTitle is the score of matching reference's titleName.

total.description: Total is a simple sum of all available individual scores.

volume.description:
RefVolume is a score derived from matching volume from
reference and BHL Volume.

year.description:
Year is a score representing the quality of a year match
in a reference-string or the name-string.

gnvers.Version.description: Version provides information about the version of an application.

build.description:
Build contains the timestamp or other details
indicating when the app was compiled.

version.description: Version specifies the version of the app, usually in the v0.0.0 format.

input.Input.description: Input is used to pass data to the BHLnames API. It contains infromation about a name and a reference where the name was mentioned. Reference can point to a name usage or a nomenclatural event.

id.description:
ID is a unique identifier for the Input. It is optional and helps
to find Input data on the client side.

name.description:
Name provides data about a scientific name. Information can be
provided by a name-string or be split into separate fields.

reference.description:
Reference provides data about a reference where the name was
mentioned. Information can be provided by a reference-string or
be split into separate fields.

input.Name.description: Name provides data about a scientific name.

authors.description: NameAuthors is the authorship of a name.

canonical.description:
CanonicalSimple is the canonical form of a name, meaning the name without
authorship or a year.

canonicalStem.description:
CanonicalStem is the canonical form further normalized by removing
suffixes of specific and infraspecific epithets as well as normalizing
some interchangeable letters.

nameString.description:
NameString is a scientific name as a string. It might be enough to
provide only NameString without provided other fields.

year.description: NameYear is the year of publication for a name.

input.Params.description: Params contain options used in the search and output.

nomenEvent.description:
WithNomenEvent is true when the result tries to get a nomenclatural event
for the name.

refsLimit.description:
RefsLimit provides the maximum number of references to return for each
name.

shortenedOutput.description:
WithShortenedOutput determines if references details will be provided.
If it is `true`, found references are not provided, only the metadata
about them.

showDetails.description:
WithDetails is true when it is desirable to show more information in the
output.

sortDesc.description:
SortDesc determines the order of sorting the output data. If `true`
data are sorted by year from latest to earliest. If `false` then from
earliest to latest.

taxon.description:
WithTaxon is true when result includes data from all names that point to
a particular taxon, not only from the given name.

input.Reference.description: Reference provides data about a reference where the name was mentioned.

authors.description: RefAuthors is the authorship of a reference.

journal.description:
Journal is the title of the journal where the reference was
published.
journal.example: Systema naturae per regna tria naturae, secundum classes, ordines, genera, species, cum characteribus, differentiis, synonymis, locis.

pageEnd.description: PageEnd is the last page of the reference.

pageStart.description: PageStart is the first page of the reference.

refString.description:
RefString is a reference as a string. It might be enough to
provide only RefString without provided other fields.
refString.example: Linnaeus, C. 1758. Systema naturae per regna tria naturae, secundum classes, ordines, genera, species, cum characteribus, differentiis, synonymis, locis. Tomus I. Editio decima, reformata. Holmiae: impensis direct. Laurentii Salvii. i–ii, 1–824 pp.

volume.description:
Volume is the volume of the journal where the reference was
published.

yearEnd.description: RefYear is the year of publication for a reference.

yearStart.description: RefYear is the year of publication for a reference.
